long: Meaning: properly, a "breathing creature", i.e. "animal" of (abstractly) "vitality"; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental).  Usage: any, appetite, beast, body, breath, creature, × dead(-ly), desire, × (dis-) contented, × fish, ghost,   greedy, he, heart(-y), (hath, × jeopardy of) life (× in jeopardy), lust, man, me, mind, mortally, one, own, person, pleasure, (her-, him-, my-, thy-) self, them (your) -selves,   slay, soul,   tablet, they, thing, (× she) will, × would have it.  Source: from "H5314";
